subject: Self Care
title: Recovery Rituals
description: A quick, practical guide to Recovery Rituals.

hook.text: Athletes don't train every day at maximum intensity. They schedule recovery days. Knowledge workers rarely do.

buildup.text: Recovery rituals are planned activities that restore energy: walks, hobbies, nature, social time, or simply doing nothing.

discovery.text: Research shows that psychological detachment from work during off-hours is the strongest predictor of burnout prevention.

twist.text: Scrolling social media or watching TV doesn't count as recovery. True rest requires active engagement or genuine stillness.

climax.text: Schedule recovery like you schedule meetings. A daily walk, a weekly hobby, a monthly full day off. Non-negotiable.

punchline.text: Schedule recovery or your body will schedule it for you.

quiz.question: What is the strongest predictor of burnout prevention?
options: Psychological detachment from work during off-hours
